intro: Hackelia heliocarpa, commonly known as the sunflower bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has opposite, hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Hackelia heliocarpa is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in poor soils.
